description: Responsible for the direction of the Finance Division of HSC Shared Services.
Supervise a team of three supervisors and six accountants.
Managed the business operations of the department, coordinated the flow of information within the office, facility cores and throughout the membership.
Acted as office manager, coordinating the work of secretarial and clerical support staff and liaison with other University departments.
Maintained expenditures, prepared financial records, operating budgets and approved payments.
Interviewed, hired, trained, and directed clerical support staff.
Worked directly in the development of grant and contract proposals.
Processed payroll records, maintained employee leave records, entered purchase requisitions for equipment and supplies, and reallocated procurement card expenditures.
Arranged travel itineraries for the Center Director as well as for guest speakers, Internal and External Advisory Board members and small grant awardees.

Prepared reimbursements and honorarium payments, agendas and minutes for various Center meetings, provided tier one computer technology support, maintained software and hardware records, composed routine correspondence and formatted manuscripts and publications in accordance with the editors preferred style.

Assisted the Center Director by arranging meetings, booking travel, submitting travel reimbursements, coordinating his calendar, answering telephone calls, composing routine correspondence and formatting manuscripts and publications in accordance with the editors preferred style.

Provided support to the Center by processing hourly payroll records, maintaining employee leave records, entering purchase requisitions for equipment and supplies, reallocating procurement card expenditures, opening/sorting mail, copying materials, answering/routing telephone calls, arranging travel itineraries for guest speakers, preparing reimbursements and honorarium payments, preparing agendas and minutes for various Center meetings, providing tier one computer technology support, maintaining software and hardware records, and other duties as required by the staff and/or Center members.
Entered new orders or changes to the existing business customer's internetand telephone services.
Trained new employees to the department.
Taught Microsoft Office products, such as Excel, Word, Access, Outlook, and Windows, Wilton Cake Decorating and other Adult Education Classes.
Responsible for receiving and tracking all accounts receivable, accounts payable, all financial reports and taxes using Quick Books Computer Software.
Responsible for contracting for necessary services and repairs, customer relations, and all managerial paperwork aspects of this business.
Responsible for all aspects of the daily operations of this business.
Set up the computer system and maintained all records on Quick Books software.
Responsible for ordering, maintaining and merchandising inventory, deposits, customer relations, employee scheduling, payroll, all financial aspects including financial reports and taxes.
Responsible for secretarial duties including docketing court cases, filing, receiving telephone calls, client correspondence and client relations.
Appointed liaison for setting up the county-wide computers for their new state-wide computer system.

Responsible for ordering and maintaining all inventory supply levels, tracking employee benefit time, scheduling business appointments, receiving telephone calls, issuing personnel reports, and general secretarial duties.

Responsible for all billing and tracking of accounts receivable, scheduling business appointments, setting up and maintaining all office computers, all office correspondence, designing and implementing all promotional materials, microfilming and maintaining organization of all office documents, payroll and accounts payable functions.
